This is a classic key recovery attack when RSA-CTR is used with errors.

https://eprint.iacr.org/2002/073.pdf

GP/PARI> 
%1 = 

GP/PARI> e = 65537
%2 = 65537

GP/PARI> goodsig = 
%3 = 

GP/PARI> modexp(a, b, n) = { \
 local(d, bin); \
 d = 1; \
 bin = binary(b); \
 for (i = 1, length(bin), \
   d = Mod(d*d, n); \
   if (bin[i] == 1, \
   d = Mod(d*a, n); \
 ); \
); \
return(d);
}
GP/PARI>

GP/PARI> m = lift(modexp(goodsig, e, n))
